solution_line_template: She makes ${dog_walking_hourly_rate} an hour for {dog_walking_hours_per_morning} hours walking dogs so she makes {dog_walking_hourly_rate}*{dog_walking_hours_per_morning} = $<<{dog_walking_hourly_rate}*{dog_walking_hours_per_morning}={dog_walking_earnings_per_morning}>>{dog_walking_earnings_per_morning} every morning

Over {days_in_week} days she makes {days_in_week}*{dog_walking_earnings_per_morning} = $<<{days_in_week}*{dog_walking_earnings_per_morning}={total_dog_walking_earnings_per_week}>>{total_dog_walking_earnings_per_week} a week

She makes ${card_shop_hourly_rate} for {card_shop_hours_per_day} hours working at a card shop so she makes {card_shop_hourly_rate}*{card_shop_hours_per_day} = $<<{card_shop_hourly_rate}*{card_shop_hours_per_day}={card_shop_earnings_per_day}>>{card_shop_earnings_per_day}

She works there {card_shop_days_per_week} days a week so she makes {card_shop_days_per_week}*{card_shop_earnings_per_day} = $<<{card_shop_days_per_week}*{card_shop_earnings_per_day}={total_card_shop_earnings_per_week}>>{total_card_shop_earnings_per_week} a week

She also babysits for {babysitting_hours_per_saturday} hours making ${babysitting_hourly_rate} an hour for a total of {babysitting_hours_per_saturday}*{babysitting_hourly_rate} = $<<{babysitting_hours_per_saturday}*{babysitting_hourly_rate}={babysitting_earnings_per_saturday}>>{babysitting_earnings_per_saturday}
